abstract_summ: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus‐2 (SARS‐CoV‐2) is the third zoonotic coronavirus to be identified in humans during the twenty‐first century, after severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS‐CoV) and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS‐CoV)(Coronaviridae Study Group of the International Committee on Taxonomy,of Viruses, 2020).Here, we summarized the current known knowledge regarding epidemiological, pathogenesis, pathology, clinical features, comorbidities and treatment of COVID‐19/ SARS‐CoV‐2 as reference for the prevention and control COVID‐19.Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS‐CoV)‐2, a novel coronavirus from the same family as SARS‐CoV and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus, has spread worldwide leading the World Health Organization to declare a pandemic.Nowadays, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2), which caused novel coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) pandemic, is the worldwide challenge.Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID‐19) is a newly emerging infectious disease caused by a novel coronavirus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2).A cluster of pneumonia (COVID‐19) cases have been found in Wuhan China in late December, 2019, and subsequently, a novel coronavirus with a positive stranded RNA was identified to be the aetiological virus (severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2, SARS‐CoV‐2), which has a phylogenetic similarity to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS‐CoV).
title_summ: SARS‐CoV‐2: A comprehensive review from pathogenicity of the virus to clinical consequencesThe coronavirus (COVID‐19) fatality risk perception of US adult residents in March and April 2020Detectable SARS‐CoV‐2 viral RNA in feces of three children during recovery period of COVID‐19 pneumoniaDoes SARS‐CoV‐2 has a longer incubation period than SARS and MERS?Collaborated effort against SARS‐CoV‐2 outbreak in ChinaSARS‐CoV‐2, bacterial co‐infections, and AMR: the deadly trio in COVID‐19?A doubt of multiple introduction of SARS‐CoV‐2 in Italy: A preliminary overviewRapid detection of SARS‐CoV‐2 in saliva: can an endodontist take the lead in point‐of‐care COVID‐19 testing?Artemisia annua: Trials are needed for COVID‐19The prospects for the SARS‐CoV‐2 pandemic in AfricaScientific research progress of COVID‐19/SARS‐CoV‐2 in the first five monthsCOVID‐19 diagnosis and management: a comprehensive reviewThree months of COVID‐19: A systematic review and meta‐analysisA compendium answering 150 questions on COVID‐19 and SARS‐CoV‐2ITP flare with mild COVID‐19 infection in pregnancy: A case reportCOVID‐19: Structural Predictions of Viral Success
